name: clepsydra
content:

in the past, a device for measuring time using a flow of water: The most accurate timekeeping device of the ancient world was the waterclock or clepsydra, first found in Egypt. a clepsydra of shining bronze Synonym
water clock
More examplesFewer examplesEmpedocles' theory of respiration is remarkable for the use of an extended analogy with a clepsydra (water clock).Water clocks, also known as clepsydrae, along with sundials, are possibly the oldest time-measuring instruments.To provide a means of measuring time at night the Egyptians also invented the water-clock, or "clepsydra" as the Greeks later called it. A water clock or clepsydra is any timekeeper operated by means of a regulated flow of liquid.
